q: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
h:
“Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.
h:
“Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.
h:
“Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.
h:
“Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.
h:
“Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.” —
Bob Marley

q: If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.
h:
“If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
h:
“Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
h:
“Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower. ” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.
h:
“You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.” —
Richard Bach

q: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
h:
“We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.” —
William Faulkner

q: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
h:
“Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
h:
“Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.” —
Epictetus
